description.narrative: AusAID will support a probability sample survey of 900 citizens of the ARMM of their experience in the August 2008 ARMM elections, particularly on the use of new technology to cast and count votes. In this election, the testing of new voting technologies was done in a realistic setting so that electoral modernization can be fully implemented in the May 2010 general elections. Two technologies were used: Direct Recording Electronic (DRE) in Maguindanao province and Optical Mark Reader (printed ballots) in the other 5 ARMM provinces and one city of ARMM. AusAID will partner with The Asia Foundation (TAF) and the Social Weather Station (SWS) who we also partnered with in an earlier survey of the experience of ARMM citizens in the May 2007 elections.
